metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: JSON .parse()
A common use of JSON is to exchange data to/from a web server.
content.html: A common use of JSON is to exchange data to/from a web server.

content.text: When receiving data from a web server, the data is always a string.
content.html: When receiving data from a web server, the data is always a string.

content.text: Parse the data with JSON.parse() , and the data becomes a JavaScript object.
content.html: Parse the data with JSON.parse(), and the data becomes a JavaScript object.

content.text: Example - Parsing JSON
Imagine we received this text from a web server:
content.html: Imagine we received this text from a web server:

content.code_html: '{"name":"John", "age":30, "city":"New York"}'

content.text: Use the JavaScript function JSON.parse() to convert text into a JavaScript object:
content.html: Use the JavaScript function JSON.parse() to convert text into a JavaScript object:

content.code_html: const obj = JSON.parse('{"name":"John", "age":30, "city":"New York"}');

content.text: Make sure the text is in JSON format, or else you will get a syntax error.
content.html: Make sure the text is in JSON format, or else you will get a syntax error.

content.text: Use the JavaScript object in your page:
content.html: Use the JavaScript object in your page:

content.code_html:
<p id="demo"></p>

<script>
document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = obj.name;
</script>

content.text: Array as JSON
When using the JSON.parse() on a JSON derived from an array, the method will return a JavaScript array, instead of a JavaScript object.
content.html: When using the JSON.parse() on a JSON derived from an array, the method will return a JavaScript array, instead of a JavaScript object.

content.code_html:
const text = '["Ford", "BMW", "Audi", "Fiat"]';
const myArr = JSON.parse(text);

content.text: Exceptions
Parsing Dates
Date objects are not allowed in JSON.
content.html: Date objects are not allowed in JSON.

content.text: If you need to include a date, write it as a string.
content.html: If you need to include a date, write it as a string.

content.text: You can convert it back into a date object later:
content.html: You can convert it back into a date object later:

content.code_html:
const text = '{"name":"John", "birth":"1986-12-14", "city":"New York"}';
const obj = JSON.parse(text);
obj.birth = new Date(obj.birth);

document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = obj.name + ", " + obj.birth;

content.text: Or, you can use the second parameter, of the JSON.parse() function, called reviver .
content.html: Or, you can use the second parameter, of the JSON.parse() function, called reviver.

content.text: The reviver parameter is a function that checks each property, before returning the value.
content.html: The reviver parameter is a function that checks each property, before returning the value.

content.code_html:
const text = '{"name":"John", "birth":"1986-12-14", "city":"New York"}';
const obj = JSON.parse(text, function (key, value) {
  if (key == "birth") {
    return new Date(value);
  } else {
    return value;
  }
});

document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = obj.name + ", " + obj.birth;

content.text: Parsing Functions
Functions are not allowed in JSON.
If you need to include a function, write it as a string.
content.html: If you need to include a function, write it as a string.

content.text: You can convert it back into a function later:
content.html: You can convert it back into a function later:

content.code_html:
const text = '{"name":"John", "age":"function () {return 30;}", "city":"New York"}';
const obj = JSON.parse(text);
obj.age = eval("(" + obj.age + ")");

document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = obj.name + ", " + obj.age();

content.text: You should avoid using functions in JSON, the functions will lose their scope, and you would have to use eval() to convert them back into functions.
content.html: You should avoid using functions in JSON, the functions will lose their scope, and you would have to use eval() to convert them back into functions.
